definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek

sentences.english: We were determined to make our small business profitable.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定让我们的小生意有利可图。

sentences.english: Old habits die hard, especially when there's money to be made.
sentences.chinese: 旧习难改，尤其有利可图的时候。

sentences.english: Profit smiles on goodness when the good is profitable.
sentences.chinese: 一旦善事有利可图诗，利益就对善事媚笑起来。

sentences.english: The disposals have been extremely profitable for Goldman.
sentences.chinese: 这两次出售行为对高盛来说都是非常有利可图。

sentences.english: In the short-run, this may be a highly profitable business.
sentences.chinese: 短期内，这可能是一项极为有利可图的业务。

sentences.english: It is very difficult to be a profitable sports bettor without the ability to shop for the best line.
sentences.chinese: 很难成为有利可图的体育投注店无能力的最佳路线。

sentences.english: That has made water drilling more costly and water contracts more lucrative.
sentences.chinese: 这使得钻井取水花费巨大，供水合同更加有利可图。

sentences.english: It is possible to invest securely and profitably for the long term.
sentences.chinese: 进行有安全保障和有利可图的长期投资是可能的。

sentences.english: They want the President to rubber-stamp the bill so they can take advantage of it.
sentences.chinese: 希望总统大笔一挥，批准议案，就有利可图。

sentences.english: American wheat farmers will therefore find the dollar devaluation to be very lucrative.
sentences.chinese: 美国麦农会因此觉得美元贬值让他们有利可图。

sentences.english: Custom houses and remodels proved far more rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 定制别墅和重新改造证实了更加有利可图。

sentences.english: Pyramiding is a method for increasing a position, as it becomes profitable.
sentences.chinese: 聚合是一种增加的立场，因为它变得有利可图。

sentences.english: China's telecommunications industry will be very lucrative.
sentences.chinese: 中国大陆的通讯业将会很有利可图。

sentences.english: Investigators say the sale of false identification on the Internet is lucrative.
sentences.chinese: 调查者表示因特网上的假证生意是有利可图的。

definition: small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/exploitation
to make a profit/to earn a packet
rare commodity worth hoarding/object for profiteering
to buy and sell at a profit/to speculate
speculation and profiteering (idiom); buying and selling on speculation
to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
